attributes.action: stop doing "everything in our power" and do something tangible instead!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Below is a serious point.  The PM says nothing of substance.  I am glad you think it is humorous as this country deteriorates further under this government!


Time after time, we hear the Prime Minister say that he or the Government is doing "everything in our power" but we never seem to hear what it is he is doing.

It is about time the Prime Minister gave us some facts with honest results, and to drop this wooly line in favour of hard facts or planned actions.

Otherwise, will he please vacate number 10 so someone else can have a go!

Here is a recent pearl in his interview with Adam Boulton:

"Well I can say we will do whatever is necessary and that doesn’t rule out what is necessary for our troops"

rejection.details: We can only accept petitions where there is a clear action requested. Simply asking the PM to "do something tangible" is not considered a clear call for action. As an example, you could ask the PM to create a public document or website which lists facts relating to the outcomes of government policy.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
